revised_title: An Inquiry into the Nature of Menstrual Blood and the Role of Fermentation in Women's Health
tldr: The author examines the role of fermentation and nitrous salts in the menstrual cycle and uterine health. He also investigates the concept of sympathy in the body, discussing the connection between the womb and other parts of the female body. The text includes various experiments and observations on the effects of nitrous water and the role of milk as a nutritious substance.
